player/rules/house-rules.html.title: House Rules
player/rules/house-rules.html.description: Everyone uses Point Buy Player Point Buy Worksheet Everyone starts with 27 points. One ability should intentionally be weaker than the others. Full rebuilds are allowed until the start of Session 2. After this it will have to work narratively with DM approval after this. I'm not opposed to character changes but I'd like to avoid destabilizing the party in the process.

headers.heading: Healing Potion House Rules

player/sessions/session-0/character-conc.title: Character Concepts From Each Player
player/sessions/session-0/character-conc.description: Player Name: ___4) Character Pitch (one sentence) “I am a __ who __.”Examples: “I am a runaway acolyte who still hears my god in my dreams.” “I am a practical hunter who does not trust magic, but needs it.” DM TODO: add results to Player Characters (PCs) 5) Three Tags Pick 3: Protector Survivor Scholar Trickster Zealot Outcast Leader Caretaker Daredevil Loyalist Rebel Greedy (but redeemable) 6) Spotlight Preference Circle one: I like being central sometimes I prefer supporting others I want a mix 7) One Signature Thing About Your Character Pick one: A signature spell: __ A signature weapon style: __ A signature tool or kit: __ A signature animal companion vibe Write it: ___ 8) Two Noncombat Moves -- meant to help guide your character action (choices must make sense) Pick two: I can talk my way into places I can sneak and scout I can heal or stabilize reliably I can solve mysteries (investigation, insight) I can navigate wilderness I can craft or repair I can read magic or detect danger

player/sessions/session-0/player-point-b.title: Player Point Buy Worksheet
player/sessions/session-0/player-point-b.description:
9) Point Buy Stats Strength is crushing a tomato.
Dexterity is dodging the tomato when someone throws it at you.
Constitution is eating a rotten one and not being ill because of it.
Intelligence is knowing a tomato is a fruit
Wisdom is knowing not to put it in a fruit salad.
Charisma is convincing people to buy your tomato-based fruit salad.D&D 5e Point Buy Cost Table
Point buy in D&D 5e gives you 27 points to spend on your six ability scores before racial bonuses.You cannot raise a score above 15 before racial bonuses. Once the 27 points are spent, you apply racial bonuses, pick your class, and you are done. This ensures everyone starts balanced while still choosing what their character is good at and where they are weaker.When creating your character in D&D Beyond, please follow these steps exactly.
Create or open your character.
Go to the Abilities section.
Under Generation Method, select Point Buy.
You will see all ability scores start at 8 and a pool of 27 points.
Use the plus and minus buttons to raise or lower scores. You cannot raise any score above 15 before racial bonuses. Once you have spent all 27 points, stop.
Apply your racial bonuses automatically when prompted.
Do not roll for stats and do not use standard array.
That’s it. If you get stuck, stop and we will finish it together in Session 0.

headers.heading: Example 5e Point Buy Spends by Class Type (27 Points)
Player Instructions: Using Point Buy in D&D Beyond

player/sessions/session-0/table-setup-an.title: Table Setup and Expectations
player/sessions/session-0/table-setup-an.description:
1) Campaign Tone
Circle one: Cozy heroic Classic heroic with danger Dark fairy tale with hope Grim and morally messy 2) Party Contract
Answer yes or no:
We are a cooperative party (no sabotage): Y / N
Secrets between characters are allowed if they create story not conflict: Y / N
PvP is only allowed with prior consent: Y / N
Party splits will be kept short and rare: Y / N
3) Safety and Boundaries Non-Negotiable:
No harm to children
No sexual violence of any kind
Party Discussion:
Fade to black for romance
Avoid torture detail
Other: ___

player/sessions/session-0.html.title: Session 0
player/sessions/session-0.html.description:
Most of this Session 0 will include some in-class homework with teacher supervision ;) ... All the places where you see a * will have a worksheet printed for you to fill out as we work through the session on Feb 1 2025.Pre Session Homework (easiest you'll ever have): Make sure I have your contact info (SMS/EMAIL) Pick your character class (think everyone has this done) Pick a character Name Pick a visual description for your character (can be as simple or as complex as you like I'm going to dump these in GPT to get some pics of you hooligans) Table Setup and Expectations (10 mins)Technical DND Beyond Setup for each player (20 mins): Install DnD Beyond App on phones/iPad (if desired) Setup DnD Beyond Accounts Walk through of Character Creation on DnD Beyond Website
Character Concepts From Each Player * (15-25 mins)
Player Point Buy Worksheet - * (5-10 mins)
Equipment Selection - * (5-10 mins)
Party Weaving - * (10 mins)

player/sessions/session-0/party-weaving..title: Party Weaving
player/sessions/session-0/party-weaving..description:
Player Name: ___11) One Connection
Choose one:
I owe another character a debt Another character saved me once I do not trust one character yet I admire one character
Write who and why: ___ 12) One Shared Goal
Pick one party goal:
Protect the innocent Get paid and stay alive Seek truth and expose corruption Redeem someone or something Prove ourselves 13) One Line and One Hook
Line: “I will never __.” Hook: “I cannot resist __.”
14) Pick a bond or fear

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
